text: The movie will begin in five moments  The mindless voice announced  All those unseated will await the  next show  We filed slowly, languidly into the  hall  The auditorium was fast and silent  As we seated and were darkened  The voice continued  "The program for this evening is not  new  You've seen this entertainment  Through and through  You've seen your birth, your life  and death  You might recall all the rest  Did you have a good world when you  died?  Enough to base a movie on?"
A dark silence hovers along the deserted, bunker-like stu MIKE stands and booms shadow a grand piano... The ENGINEER waits in the booth, lit, alert man, bored,  fiddling...
Hey Jim, It's your birthday man,  whaddaya say we try this another  night...

Camera moving tentatively along the shadows, discovering sidelight on a Navy surplus pea jacket thrown on a chair; moving to a candle's orange flutter on pages written with verse... a hand breaking the seal of the bottle of Irish  Bushmill's whiskey.
(off) Kill the lights a little more, will  ya John?

They might drop a bit more... Camera crawling past the FI weaving a new cigarette out of the Marlboro pack. An asht full of butts... and an asthmatic horrid cough, filled wi phlegm... crawling up the slight paunch in the bright jer with #66 on it... stitched on the sleeve is the team masc an American Indian in full headdress.
(off) Hey man, how come the Doors aren't  in on this?

Camera revealing JAMES DOUGLAS MORRISON, -- 27, poet, bur in the shadows, curls of cigarette smoke about his haunte sensuous eyes, meditative lips scragged with beard and lo greasy hair, not a pretty sight, yet a man full and bold struggling for survival through his words... beneath the  Bushmill moon, he takes the tambourine and shakes it viol in our face
No music, No Doors. Let's roll... Is  everybody in?... Is Everybody in?...  Is everybody in? The ceremony is  about to begin...
He shakes a TAMBOURINE at the mike and one of his sudden  giant Indian YELLS rock through the studio.
WAKE UP!!!! HAS THIS DREAM STOPPED!!!!
Music riffs from "American Prayer". AUDIENCE SOUNDS ghost on the track. The ENGINEER reeling backwards from the sud shift in sound, cursing silent.

Let me tell you about the heartache  and the loss of God Wandering  wandering in hopeless night Indian's  scattered on dawn's highway bleeding  ghosts crowd the young childs fragile  eggshell mind... (wind sounds)
The GRIN on Jim's face magnesium flares out to:

The blinding YELLOWNESS of the desert, so barren, so hot stings to look at. An OLD CHEVROLET winds through the yel orange landscape beneath a brooding blue SKY crackling wi ELECTRICITY -- the storm coming in in the distance as the MUSIC writhes out at us like a reptile from under a rock the beat of RIDERS ON THE STORM.
Riders on the storm (2)  Into this house we're born  Into this world we're thrown  Like a dog without a bone  An actor out on loan  Riders on the storm

(continues over imagery) ...me and my mother and father and  grandmother and grandfather were  driving through the desert at dawn  and a truckload of Indian workers  had either hit another car or just --  I don't know what happened... Indians  were scattered all over the highway  bleeding to death.

MOM, DAD, the youngest BABY in the front seat -- pointing the storm. GRANDMA & GRANDAD in the back with JIM, about 4 and his  SISTER, 3 asleep. Mom's a beauty and Dad's an austere handsome military man civilian clothes, mouthing words -- look, wake them up, a desert storm... but we barely hear A LIGHTNING BOLT shreds the blue sky with a thunderous so frightening dawn of creation... Grandma nudging Jim awake. His eyes open -- Just as the car turns the bend -- revealing An overturned TRUCK lying in the road -- dead and wounded INDIANS everywhere... A cop car, ambulance. A terrible  accident... The first thing Jim sees... An old INDIAN FACE staring at him... The car pulling alongside, Dad rolling his window down... asking if he can help (SOUNDLESS) A line of wailing INDIA
Mom's scared face...
...but it was the first time I tasted  fear. I musta been about four, like  a child is just like a flower, his  head is floating in the breeze.
Grandma trying to hide Jim's face but he looks back...
The kid looking back through the rear window, terrified - his first view of death. The bodies, the sense of doom  overlaying the land -- a child's worst nightmare.
It's just a dream, Jimmy, just a  dream

(continues)  There's a killer on the road  His brain is squirming like a toad  Take a long holiday  Let your children play  If you give this man a ride  Sweet family will die  There's a killer on the road The boy's eyes going back to the Indian MAN looking at hi then to the dying opened body bleeding out its guts on th asphalt... the dying man's face, twisted, moaning, amazin eyes at the point of death -- they settle on Jim
It's just a dream Jimmy, just a dream

A strange SOUND occurs -- the rattle of an ancient gourd, "shi-chi-chi, shi-chi-chi". Something flying through the  air. A bull-roarer, a whirling leather thong, announcing appearance of a shaman. INTO JIM -- his eyes staring out the back His receding po of view -- the Indians, the overturned truck...

...The reaction I get now looking  back is the soul of the ghosts of  those dead Indians -- maybe one or  two of them were just running around  freaking out and just leaped into my  soul -- and they're still there. (wind, music)
Girl you gotta love your man (2)  Take him by the hand  Make him understand The car pulling away across the giant 1940's landscape
Panning up the black chino pants to JIM MORRISON, now 20, steel seaman's suitcase in hand, thumbing a ride, the roa sign behind him saying "Los angeles 370 miles"
The world on you depends  Our life will never end  Girl you gotta love your man A LARGE LIZARD in the dust cocks its head, blinks, as the boots walk by to the car pulling over.

JIM in the backseat packed with HUSBAND, WIFE, CHILDREN,  DOG, MOTHER-IN-LAW. Between boy and man, eyes ancient and new. He wears his favorite color: black -- torn black chi paint-spotted black t-shirt, a slouch his favorite pose b the eyes and smile can be warm and shy like a little boy, gentle surface, storm in the brain. The HUSBAND, now looking at Jim a little nervously, pushe up the Perry Como on the radio... as it cuts to a sudden  news flash:
...from the Texas School Book  Depository. We repeat. President  John F. Kennedy was shot a few minutes  ago in Dallas!
SLOW MOTION: The Husband's face distorting, saying someth on the track like: "What! God NO!" but it's subdued, low. Trying other stations. Jim turns to look out his window, as if he already knew.
(2nd VOICE) ...taken to Parkland Memorial  Hospital. There's no word on the  President's condition. Mrs. Kennedy  is...
The WIFE'S and HUSBAND'S VOICES seem lost in the backgrou
Oh God, Oh God. Not the President  for Christ's sake. Oh God -- WHO'S  NEXT?
On Jim -- staring out the window. "Who's next!"
Riders on the storm (4) On the DESERT.

CREDITS continue to their conclusion as we segue into the BLUENESS of VENICE, CALIFORNIA, 1965 -- the dawn of a new age. All was possible. Individual SHOTS of the BOARDWALK throbbing with a feast HIPPIES, head shops, ARTISTS drawing psychedelic murals, SMOKERS, MUSCLE BUILDERS, tambourines accompanying the  transister radios on the Beach Boys and "I Got You Babe", dogs chasing frisbees, BIKINI BODIES on the beach, LSD so over the counter... set to the upbeat chords of HELLO I L

Hello I love you  Won't you tell me your name?  Hello I love you  Let me jump in your game  She's walking down the street  Blind to every eye she meets  Do you think you'll be the guy  To make the queen of the angels sigh? JIM, in torn black chinos, no shirt, walking real slow pa it all, carrying a notebook of his own and a paperback of Baudelaire, his eyes settling on... A YOUNG BEAUTY and her yellow labrador -- a fashionable t long, red-haired "20th century fox" in jeans moving throu the crowd... He thinks about it -- a fraction of eternity -- and he's  off... after her.

She moves along its banks, as if the universe moved to he rhythm, turning once to look back. Jim caught in her eyes They're alone. Now he's the one seized by doubt. He slows pretends to take another interest.
She holds her head so high  Like a statue in the sky  Her arms are wicked  And her legs are long  When she moves  My brain screams out this song
As she turns into another street, he resumes following he She gets to a house, goes in. There's a group of people  partying. He stops, watches.
Sidewalk crouches at her feet  Like a dog that begs for something sweet  Do you hope to make her see you, fool?  Do you hope to pluck this dusky jewel?

The two story house has a quaint run-down charm. Friends  have dropped by, people smoking joints, beers. She's on the upstairs balcony -- talking with a YOUNG MAN (professor type) in his 30's, who passes her a joint. JIM lurks in the shadows of the trees; he's been standing outside watching... The MUSIC shifts to the quieter LOVE  STREET.

She lives on Love Street  Lingers long on Love Street  She has a house and garden  I would like to see what happens The YOUNG MAN gestures, and goes back inside the house. S alone now on the balcony, sitting on a kitchen table... It's now or never. Jim scales the tree alongside the hous with the agility of a gymnast.

She has robes and she has monkeys  Lazy diamond studded flunkies  She has wisdom and knows what to do  She has me and she has you The girl's grinding up pot in an old shoebox with a spoon and kitchen strainer. She looks up and sees his crotch th feet from her face, balanced there effortlessly on the ra like a highwire act, opens her mouth in surprise. Jim drops softly to the balcony, a smile of disarming  gentleness.
Hi...
Wow! Hi... (looking at the tree) You have a problem with doors?
Waste of time...
His head cocked slightly onto his left shoulder, he drawl southern gentleman, polite, slow, thoughtful as if he had all the time in the world, as if the guy would never come back.
I followed you... from the beach...
(impressed) Wow! You followed me? Why?
...cause... you're the one...
He moves. Kisses her swiftly, softly, right on the lips.
(mesmerized, awkward) Wow... neat... (looks back) ...maybe you should meet my old man?
Later. You got a name?

He looks into her face. Classic American face, freckles, round eyes soft as rain, long sunset red hair. She feels intense, starving eyes. He kisses her a second time. The YOUNG MAN coming back with the rolling paper -- sees  him. As he hops back on the railing -- swings out into the tre looks back once.
Mine's Jim.
A moment. She must decide. The YOUNG MAN within earshot.
Pam...
The ice broken in that instant. Jim smiles.
Jim and Pam, Pam and Jim...
He vanishes. The Man abreast of Pamela, as if he's seen a vision.
Who the hell was that?
(everything's cool) That's Jim. My new friend.

On the screen a 16mm black and white student film of a  stunning BLOND in black bra, panties, garters dancing in  black heels on top of a TV set. panning down to images of goose-stepping Nazis and a Nuremberg rally on the set. So of lovemaking and an Indian peyote ceremony from the trac an Indian holy man incanting... Jim's VOICE comes on the  track as well.
Nietzche said "all great things must  first wear monstrous and terrifying  masks in order to inscribe themselves  on the hearts of humanity". Listen  children -- to the sound of the  Nuremberg night.

STUDENTS in the audience groan at the pretention of it. M to JIM's eyes hidden in his parka hood, peeking through a the screen. A CLOSEUP now of JIM on screen looking straight into the  lens as he takes a hit on a hash pipe, and winks.
(on screen) Have you ever seen God? -- a mandala.  A symmetrical angel. Felt? Yes.  Fucking the Sun. Heard? The music.  Voices. Touched? An animal. Your  hand Tasted? Rare meat, corn, water  and wine
(ad lib) SSSSssss... ego trip man, c'mon!
RAY MANZAREK, a tall student with powerful voice and mann thick glasses, long hair sweeping down over his eyes, lea over to Jim.
Hey man it's great, don't listen to  em, it's non-linear man, it's poetry  man, everything Godard stands for.

The lights coming on as the last absurdist images flicker off. Hissing and a big Bronx cheer summarize the feelings the 100 odd STUDENTS crammed into a bunker-like theater. A youngish INSTRUCTOR stirs to the front row from a row o upset FACULTY. Hands shooting up to criticize.

This is pretty shocking stuff Mr.  Morrison. And I might say indulgent.  Naziism and masturbation, when used  for shock value, are not art. But to  be constructive, let's start with  your intention. What was it?
It was a bore!! That's what! (laughter)
TRICK, BONES and JACK, three friends sitting next to Jim, shoot their hands up.
Hey it was better'n a Warhol picture.
No it wasn't. It was worse!
A guy sleeping for seven hours...
...is less pretentious! There was no  political consciousness. Naziism  is...
Hey hold on man! You guys are the  facists!
It takes genitalism to absurdity  man, just cause the squares here  can't dig it cause the film school's  still so square...
Oh c'mon man, give it a break. Boo!  Beatniks go home! Take another  mushroom...
A cacophony of voices, critics, emotions blend out over J quiet eyes.
HOLD IT DOWN!!... Mr. Morrison --  what are your feelings?
I quit. (walks out)
JIM, BONES, TRICK, JACK approaching the bar. MUSIC of "GL blasting from the door, CHICKS popping in and out, defini college crowd circa '65.
(to Jim) Hey man whatdya expect, an Oscar?
You can't quit, you gotta voice.  People can't dig cause they don't  understand yet.
If you're an individual, if you're  too good, they wanna cut your dick  off. Look what happened to Orson  Wells.
You quit now, they'll yank your  deferment in no time and they'll get  you for Vietnam man. Three more months  you graduate.
Be cool, you never learned fuckin  patience Morrison, you want everything  at once.
They didn't get it. So make your  films and fuck what they think.
You know what I think?
He slows, a dramatic young lion pose, surveying the girls
Yeah whadday you think?
You really want to know what I think?
The cronies wait, anticipating something inescapably evil escape his lips.
Yeah yeah, whatddaya think?
I think we gotta get really ripped!
Tall bespectacled RAY MANZAREK is banging out GLORIA on t piano in bad Jerry Lee Lewis style.
I tell you bout my baby 'bout five  foot four from head to toe She came  to my room Just 'bout midnight She  makes me feel so good She makes me  feel alright

Camera moving to reveal JOHN DENSMORE wiry, solid on the  drums... moving on to ROBBIE KRIEGER, wispy, ethereal loo the youngest, flamenco-type moves on his early electric  guitar. Also a HARMONICA PLAYER and a BASE. They all seem slightly embarrassed by either the cheap sound system fee or Ray's warbling, but the crowd couldn't care less -- a  German beerhall, they want noise and sex. JIM and his GANG, beers in hand, mouth back the words, be everywhere shoved to the smokey ceiling, everyone on thei feet, nuts with spring fever. Jim eyeing the GIRL next to him.
You know what I'd like to do to you?
(waiting, intrigued) No what?
You really want to know what I'd  like to do to you?
What!
The FOOTBALL TEAM TYPES edge over nearby, one of them pic out Jim with a glare.
(whispering) Wanna hear the scream of the  butterfly...
She looks puzzled by the suggestion.
Hey Morrison!
(eluding the man) Can we have a couple of beers. You're  not even an asshole man -- you're a  semihole.

He evades the football man's grasp, elusive physicality. hops over tables, heading for the stage. Other KIDS are u on the stage dancing, but Jim goes right up alongside RAY shaking his hips like Elvis. Ray giving him the mike. Imp time.
(singing) She came to my room  She came on my floor  She came on my bed  She came on my face  Ooooooh I want to wrap your legs  around my head baby baby and her  name was Gloria
They love it. The place going wild. The girl with the foo player wanting him.
JIM is insane on beers in the back seat, reaching over th wheel to try to drive the car for RAY who is flailing at  him. Jim pulling Ray's hair...
(barely comprehensible) HA HA HA HA HA! COME ON, LET'S DRIVE  TO MEXICO MAN. TIJUANA. LET'S GET  LOST!
Jammed into the sedan are TRICK, BONES, ROBBIE, JOHN...
COOL IT JIM, COME ON COOL IT.
FREEDOM!!! DON'T YOU KNOW YOU'RE ALL  SLAVES!
As he winds down the window and starts crawling out of th car. Heavy traffic. Ray weaving to avoid another vehicle. Honking horn.
HE'S GOING OUT! HE'S GOING OUT!
HE'S GONNA JUMP!
GET HIM BACK IN!
His waist is out the window, John and all grabbing for hi heels.
SPECIAL EFFECT: JIM's head six inches from pavement movin at 60 mph through heavy traffic. Screaming, laughing like maniac. Beeping horns all over the place.
DEATH OLD FRIEND!!
In the car, madness, raging chaos, the four boys pulling in.
Night. Shadows. A tree. A figure moving.

Awake!  Shake dreams from your hair, my pretty child my sweet one Choose the day and choose the sign of your day  The day's divinity the first thing you see Jim slides her upstairs' door open, crawls in next to her bed. She's asleep with her boyfriend. He touches her toe. She awakes, startled.
Come on, come out for a walk, it's a  pretty night.
You're crazy!
JIM and PAMELA moving along the byways. A clear starry  California night.

A vast radiant beach  And a cool jewelled moon  Couples naked, race down by its quiet side  And we laugh like soft mad children There's a crash. They turn bristling. A COYOTE lurks under the sickly light of a streetlamp, pu its head from an overstuffed garbage can, looking back at them.
Fires on the boardwalk. Hippies, Bums, Older People. JIM PAM move through talking, skipping, touching like childre
...smug in the wooly cotton brains of infancy  The music and voices are all around us  Choose, they croon, the ancient ones  The time has come again
The two of them race down by its side, slowing to a walk. His [...] loved orphan voice.
Can I stay with you tonight? We could  talk 'till dawn. I just don't want  to be alone.
(hesitant) Okay... just talk though. No funny  stuff.
Okay. I promise.
I've been real upset. I lost my car  on the freeway yesterday. I left it  somewhere and I can't remember where  and when I went back it was gone. My  sister...
I bet you never expected life could  be this hard. (strokes her hair  affectionately) And you're still so young.
She breaks into sobs, seeking his arms. He hugs her.
I wonder where we'll be ten years  from now?
I really don't want to know
Come on.
Choose now, they croon  Beneath the moon  Beside an ancient lake  Enter again the sweet forest  Enter the hot dream  Come with us  Everything is broken up and dances
Their silhouettes mount the fire escape of a jagged old  structure overlooking the boardwalk.

PAM glancing through Jim's notebooks as they sit on his  sleeping bag with a lantern and bunsen burner, overlookin moon, ocean, scudding clouds and a vast forest of televis antennas. Fires burn from the beach. In the notebooks, at intervals during the conversation, w see powerful sketches colored in visionary hallucinogenic William Blake mode with writing between. Books are everyw panning Kerouac, Ginsberg, Nietzsche, Rimbaud, Mailer, Ar mythological works, shamanistic books, a library of stole ideas.
(reading, looking) These are like beautiful! I never  read much poetry in school. I hated  it. What's a "shaman"? (mispronounces)

He's the medicine man who starts in  a peyote trance. And he gets everyone  in the tribe going and they share in  his vision and it heals them. It's  the same in all cultures -- Greeks,  Jesus. Some Indians say the first  shaman invented sex. He's the one  who makes you crazy.
Are you a "shaman"?
Uh (pause) no. I just write about it. What turns  you on?

I don't know. Experience. Freedom.  Love... Now. Peyote's like love.  When it's given it's blessed. When  it's sold it's damned. I like peyote.  I like acid, it's easier to get. I  like the spiritual voyage. The first  time I did acid I saw God. I did. I  had a friend who was Christ. And he  was Judas too. I suddenly knew the  secret of everything -- that we're  all one, the universe is one. And  that everything is beautiful.
Is it? I don't know. I think you're  alive by confronting death -- by  experiencing pain.
I think you're alive by recognizing  beauty -- seeing truth because when  you discover truth you discover what  love is... we're all saying the same  thing. It's "love me and I'll love  you."
(looks at her, ironic) It's only thru death that you know  life. Jesus, medicine men heal people  by sacrificing their own life.
Do you love Death?
I think life hurts a lot more than  death. When you die the pain is over.
Pam shivers, a strange thought.
Why do I look at you... and see my  death? (pause, shrugs) No, that's ridiculous.
I bet your dad's a school teacher.
How did you know!
I don't know.
What was your father?
Military
I bet you moved around a lot.
Yeah, about 8 times.
How many sisters and brothers?
Two.
One... she's the pretty one... I  love your neck. (she gets in his lap)
He runs his fingers thru her hair, kissing her gently.
"...but one, the most beautiful one  of all dances in a ring of fire and  throws off the challenge with a shrug"
That's beautiful. Who did you write  it for?
I wrote it for you.
The panties coming off. Rousseau dangling from the Venice moon. He moves a little over excited, nervous, more awkwa than we might expect.
...take your time, Jim... there's no  hurry, I'm all you have to do  tonight...

Well the clock says it's time to close now  I guess I'd better go now...  As we depart the rooftop.  Your fingers weak with minarets  Speaking secret alphabets  I light another cigarette  Learn to forget, learn to forget, learn to forget

Possibly we hear the soft backbeat of MOONLIGHT DRIVE wit lyrics. RAY MANZAREK is meditating in yoga posture, longer hair a well, in his post-graduate phase, sandals, colorful hippi shirt. But the meditation is not going well. He's shaking his head at himself, frowning.
Om om... No bliss! No bliss!
Jim has approached closer, amused, looking down.
Hey Ray, try acid man, it's  guaranteed.
Ray opening his eyes -- his POV -- Jim, slouched, jacket  over his shoulder, sun behind him.
(surprised) Morrison... Aw shit. Last trip I  thought I was going through hell's  digestive system. Something painted  by Hieronymus Bosch.
I never had a bummer on acid.
I like naturally high man.
Whatever works. Making movies at MGM  yet?
Well I saw the head of production  and I said Godard doesn't use scripts,  he improvises with his camera and he  said, "great who's Godard?"
(laughs) We gotta take the planet back,  reinvent the Gods, make new myths.
Right on. I thought you went to New  York?
Never got there. Went out to the  desert and uh... got lost y'know.  Days. I been living on Trick's  rooftop. Got stuck on this chick...
Whatcha been doing?
Writing. Poems. Songs.
Songs? Lemme hear one.
I can't sing.
So neither can Dylan. "Johnny's in  the basement mixing up the medicine,  I'm on the pavement thinking about  the government". But he's got the  words man. That's what they want.
(suddenly sings) Let's swim to the moon un hunh  Let's climb thru the tide  Penetrate the evening  That the city sleeps to hide

Jim has crouched, digging his hand in the sand. As the gr spill out of his fist he has his eyes closed. Ray pantomimes chords in the keyboard sand. All of a sudd we're in RAY'S POV -- a mystical moment. Jim singing, no  sound, then pure song, unadulterated by atmosphere.
Let's swim out tonight love  It's our turn to try  Parked beside the ocean  On our moonlight drive
Jim stops, shrugs. Ray looks at him a long beat. Intense  eyes, the manner of a man who knows what he wants and can be stopped.
Wow!... Y'know man those are hot  lyrics -- really hot!
(pleased) ...could you write the music for  that down, if we went over to your  place, could you write that on your  organ?
Are you kidding! I could fly. You  wrote that? You got others?
A bunch. It's like I'm taking notes  at a rock concert going on inside my  head. I actually hear the music --  the spirit of the wine y'know,  intoxication.
(slaps him on the  knee) Man. You got a voice like Chet Baker --  haunted! What the hell happened to  you in the desert? Let's get a rock  and roll band together man and make  a million bucks.
...be great wouldn't it?
(walking JIM) It's the perfect time man! Two of  the guys outta my band are really  into this. I meditate with them. You  know them... Robbie and John. We  could have it in the can in three  weeks.
Hey why not, I could write the songs  with you guys.

The Stones did it outta the London  School of Economics for Chrissake.  Things are about to explode man. You  can feel it in the air. (points out over the  ocean) Vietnam's right out there. Sides are  being chosen. People wanna fight or  fuck, love or kill, everything's  gonna flame. The planet's screaming  for change, Morrison. Make the myths  man!!
Jim laughs, loves Ray's ardor as they move along the ocea side.

There oughta be great orgies man.  Like when Dionysus arrived in Greece,  he made all the women mad, leaving  their homes and dancing off in the  mountains. Great golden copulations  in the streets of LA. (looks at a passing  girl) Hey, do you know her?
What do we call ourselves. "Dionysus"?
I got a name.
What?
The Doors.
The Doors? (facial distaste) That's the most ridiculous... (then) ...you mean the doors in your mind?  Like the Huxley book.
"The Doors of Perception"? Acid...
Yeah sure mescaline experiments --  reducing the sugar flow to the brain.  Great book.
It's from William Blake actually,  the line -- "when the doors of  perception are cleansed -- things  will appear as they truly are..."
(finishes) -- infinite". It's great, Jim.
So where do we start? How do we start?  Where are the girls?
Rehearsing. You're moving off the  rooftop and in with me and Dorothy.
As they walk off, the two of them along the edge of the  Pacific. A dog jumping for a frisbee. The music of MOONLI DRIVE now riffs over the real song now.
Let's swim to the moon  Let's climb thru the tide  Penetrate the evening  That the city sleeps to hide...

The first heavy strains of BREAK ON THROUGH driving over DISSOLVE. It sounds bad technically, but it's hot. Random raw screams and shouting. PAM is crosslegged on the floor clapping to the music, number one fan.
(live) The day destroys the night  Night divides the day  Tried to run  Tried to hide  Break on thru to the other side
JIM straining to make it work, jumping around violent, st not in control. Yet searching. JOHN cutting out.
That's really square. Let's hip it  up. Jump on your cues.
Tighten it up. Stay with the beat  Jim. You're dragging.
Let's try it again, come on. I'm  just getting into it.
(on floor) I think it's hot!!
(strumming) I still think the lyrics are weird  man.
(frustrated) I still think it sounds like the  bottom of a fishbowl man.
(to Robbie, aggravated) Then you write one man! We need more  songs anyway. We all gotta go back  and write.

They're drained, tired, in a large rehersal/living room 3 feet high, fronted by large glass windows looking out at beach at Marina. The room is filled with golden, gorgeous setting sunlight. PAMELA goes to the kitchen with DOROTHY, Ray's Japanese  fiancee.

I been working on something goes  like this... A minor. (chords his guitar) "You know that it would be untrue  You know that I would be a liar  If I was to say to you  Girl, we couldn't get much higher"  F sharp... chorus  "Come on baby, light my fire  Try to set the night on fire..."
Robbie's voice is tinny but something immediate's in the  air, all the radar out.
Okay man there's some good changes  in there.
Got any more lyrics?
(gives Jim a page of  lyrics) Some. I call it "Light My Fire". I  figger if I'm gonna compete with  your stuff it's gotta be about earth,  fire or snakes.
Don't underestimate Death.
Yeah but it sounds like the Byrds  man, we're not folk rock man. How  'bout trying it with a Latin beat.
I thought we could do the usual verse  chorus verse chorus and
We don't need a bridge.
Yeah, we could maybe improvise a  couple piano and guitar solos over  it (kicks in second verse) "The time to hesitate is through" (doesn't have the  second line) Du du duh dud dada . . .
(spontaneous) "No time to wallow in the mire  Try now we can only lose  And our love become a funeral pyre  Come on baby light my fire"
John drumming it, different, more Latin.
Pretty good! Pretty neat!!

...you are a prince among white men,  yet you are a warrior among us. You  are ready now. Go out "walk with the  pain of the world, travel to the end  of the wind" -- and change it for  all men as you were born to do.

Come on Jim, let's go.
(childlike) Don't you guys wanna meet Andy Warhol?
Tell you the truth, I can live without  him. He's a freak. Let's get outta  here. We got a show tomorrow.
Come on man! I thought we were gonna  be a band, the four of us -- and  party all night, rock and roll!
(laughs) I could never keep up with you Jim.  I couldn't make the music.
Jim's eyes briefly on -- Pamela giggling with the French  Count, putting her hand on his arm as she laughs. Innocen nothing meant but a moment...
(desperate mockery,  grabs Ray) Don't go. Don't leave! You can't  leave. I don't know what will happen.  It might be Death.
Come on Jim, this isn't our scene,  these people are vampires. We gotta  stick together man, the four of us.  Let's make the myths man.

A moment, strange. Slightly SLOW MOTION. Ray tapping Jim' shoulder goodbye... Robbie and John's faces passing on. A if they're parting -- in a symbolic way. Jim blinking in same SLOW MOTION, looking. Nico is gone -- but Tom is the across the room, waving. The INDIAN SHAMAN looks like he's standing there in a cor Jim, ripped, heads for him, but the PR WOMAN cuts him off Jim forgets he saw the Indian.
Right here Jim, right here. Andy's  waiting. You know what you have in  common is uniqueness.
Past more faces. The Music has subtly shifted to STRANGE  DAYS somewhere along the way.

Strange days have found us  Strange days have tracked us down  They're going to destroy  Our casual joys  We shall go on playing or find a new town Past a cache of QUEENS in white leather ogling Jim, one o them coming over boldly, chatting him up (AD LIB dimly he them grabbing his crotch and kissing him. Jim rearing bac laughing but wary. Past the RICH LADIES dripping with jew and faces peeled from Brazilian sleep tanks and Swiss kni Past a YOUNG MAN dressed in Jim Morrison leather pants wi his hair and eye make-up, a warped image of Jim, smiling  back at him.
(looking for Nico) Nico!

A quieter room, drugged out, the PR GUY cheerily leading  JIM, stepping over SLEEPING BODIES, over fur coats strewn across the floor... to a MAN with white hair like a circu clown, his back to us, talking with some black-tied EUROP ARISTOCRATS looking so cool.
Well, it was such a big opening, we  just had to go to Philadelphia,  y'know, you were supposed to, mmm...
(butting in) Andy! Andy!

ANDY turning at the interruption. He looks like a chic vo doll. Holding an incongruous gold telephone in his arms l a teddy bear. Slightly SLOW MO as Warhol's black empty eyes confront Ji a pit of nothingness in them, amnesia, death. In Jim's SL MOTION reaction we read what he sees. Andy going on with story, to the group that includes TOM BAKER.
...but so many people showed up, the  paintings were getting crushed, so  they took them all down... um, it  really looked great y'know... maybe  uhhh... (long pause)

(cutting in) ...the walls. The blank walls. Andy  was the art. Should do a show. Just  walls. Today it's really about people,  not what they do. It's the astronaut  that matters, not the voyage, the  actor, not the movie -- how do I  say, it's the trip, not arriving.
Andy is looking at Jim. Jim at Andy.
(babbling on) ...you know what Andy says, some day  everybody's gonna be famous for 15  seconds, but it won't mean anything.
That's too short. I need a coupla  hours.
They laugh. Andy's eyes hidden, face as white as styrofoa
We'd just love to have you in our  movies Jim, you're so beautiful,  you'd be so good, you mmmm, here...  this is for you Jim.
Andy shows his eyes, gives Jim the gold telephone he's  carrying.
Edie gave this to me and said mmmmm,  I could talk to God with this. But I  don't really have anything to say.  So... mmmm now you can talk to God.  Oh hi!
Vanishes, waving to somebody else. Jim holding the phone.
Strange days have found us  And through their strange hours  We linger alone Nico reappears waving at him to come quickly.
Morrison!

SNOW on the streets... a group of DRUGGIES staggering in snowbanks, throwing snowballs, stupid giggling, wheezing  puffs of cold air... Jim throws the golden telephone into the trash and pees o it. IRIS SHOTS continue -- PAMELA laughing battily with TOM B who's putting the make on her... The COUNT is on heroin. JIM passing a vodka bottle back and forth with NICO hitti a stash of ups. They fall in the snow, mad Russian winter
Bodies confused  Memories misused  As we run from the day  To a strange night of stone  (SONG REPEATS OVER)

BLACK & WHITE IRIS SHOTS continue -- imagistic,  disassociative. A LONG CORRIDOR -- COUPLE staggering down the red carpets champagne bottles in hand. The COUNT gets lost. PAM laughing -- suddenly alone, notices, goes looking for Jim... floating down this endless corridor with white doo and red carpet.

NICO stripping... a superb body... riding the floors... Jim taking an amyl nitrate with her... laughing... Nico w that crazed German laugh... PAMELA pushing the elevator  buttons wildly... The elevator opening on her. From Pamela's POV -- Nico do on her knees, her blonde head buried in Jim's leather pan Jim pinned against the back wall, smiling dopically, eyes barely registering Pam... who screams loud and long, hidi his eyes... not wanting to know... The images faster and  more fragmented: Pam beating at Jim wildly. He's laughing Nico's laughing. The Aristocrats in the hallway are laugh The world is laughing with its madness.
Strange days have found us  Strange days have tracked us down

An eager rowdy CROWD chants DOORS! DOORS! DOORS! DOORS! t stage without the Doors. TECHIES are moving amplifiers,  running sound checks, stalling time, the MANAGER SIDDONS  gauging the crowd, nervous. RICH GIRLS and LOCAL HONCHOS  have backstage passes. COPS crawling over the stage, the  PROMOTER of the concert trying to get the crowds attentio
(at mike) Testing one-two-three. Testing.
(on mike) Look, the Fire Marshall's not gonna  let the show go on. Either you go  back to your seats, you go to the  aisle, you don't do that -- no show!
(pushing towards stage,  no aisles) DOORS! DOORS! DOORS! (turning to) MORRISON! MORRISON! MORRISON!

The SOUNDS of the CROWD pound thru the hallway. CAMERA  following JIM reading a magazine article, accompanied by  PATRICIA KENNEALY -- past the TECHIES, turning to look -- they go into empty SHOWER ROOM.
The Crowd NOISE still carries, echoing. JIM leads PATRICI to a quiet, isolated stall where they can be alone. Tappi the magazine, sincerely moved by what he reads.
"Lord Byron"? Really. You think? You  like the poems?
Like? I loved them! "Mad bad and  dangerous to know." That's what they  said about him. Your poems should be  taken as seriously.
These are the kindest words I've  ever heard in my life. No one has  ever understood. Thank you. (then) Maybe I should always fuck my critics.
Y'know I don't even like rockers.  They're sleazy. I made up my fuck  list the other night -- out of 30  guys there were maybe three of them,  y'know. I'm not a groupie.
(hotter, grabs her) Let's do it, here, now... with the  sound of the crowd. Like Nuremberg,  wild German fucking.
You like that hunh? Beg!
I'm begging! I'm begging you!
You wanna fuck me, Morrison, don't  ever lie to me again. Ever!
About what!
Your father. Why do you tell me  bullshit like your father's dead?
(pissed) What's your problem with fathers!  They're dead, both of them, I told  you.
If he's so dead, then who answered  the phone when I called the house?
Jim -- a look, struck.

(knowing look) You didn't really think you'd get  away with that, Morrison. An Admiral  in the United States Navy. Who's at  the Gulf of Tonkin when Vietnam  starts. Your Dad's a Deputy Chief of  Operations.
What'd he say? That was really stupid.  Why didn't you just ask me.
Well naturally he wasn't too happy  when I called. Your Mom wanted to  talk but he shut her off.
You're a fuckin' cunt. You could  ruin his career if...

What, I'm a "fuckin' cunt" because I  called the house? Like it's hard to  trace your school records. University  of Florida, Albuquerque, New Mexico,  Arlington, Virginia, Washington,  D.C. Brother, sister, it's seven  miles long baby -- it's all in the  "The End", it's so easy.
Fingering his pants, her hand slips inside. Teasing,  dominating him. Her dark side radiant.
Don't ever try to hide anything from  me again. Okay? Go on... tell me.  Did he make you cut your hair? Did  he hit you, was he a bully? Did he  love you? How much?
Jim describes a small space between thumb and forefinger.
And your mother?
Jim makes a little larger space.
(pause) I don't want to talk about it. Hate  is a very underestimated emotion.

His look is right at her. Silence. Patricia knows he won' talk. Through the pause we hear the crowd chanting, bigge and bigger -- "MORRISON MORRISON MORRISON!" She's excited wanting to make love here, now. He's cooled out, however.
It doesn't matter anymore does it.  Listen to them. It's you they want  now. Not the Doors, not your mother  or your father's child... They want  you Jim.
Jim shakes his head, weary. Suddenly he's scared inside.
You're wrong. What they want I can't  give... my death -- ripped to pieces --  do you feel their power? (the noise pounding)
You have no choice, Jim. I see you  up there like Icarus. I see you flying  closer and closer to the sun. And  your wings are melting...
I want to live, Patricia. I don't  wanna die.
Jim's ironic eyes, to the ceiling. Laden with a power to  which he has married himself yet brave, resisting as she  pulls his zipper down and goes to her knees in front of h Shaking his head.
Patricia... Patricia...
A beefy COP stands there looking at them,
Whatcha doing there?
Uh... nuthin'
(approaching,  suspicious) Okay, outta there both of you. No  one's allowed backstage. Let's go.
You idiot, don't you know who...
Hey, I'm with the band man. It's  cool. Take it easy.
THE COP has no patience, grabs JIM by the arm and pulls. shoves him off. THE COP pushes back. A shoving match.
Let's go. NOW! You're both under  arrest.
(pointing to his  crotch, angry) Hey, eat it man!
The cop whips out a black can from his belt, sprays Jim.
Mace! Shit! (in pain)
Patricia screaming at the COP grabs JIM, propelling him  violently out the stall of the bathroom.
Help! They got Jim!!!
Why'd you blind me man? You blinded  me!
SIDDONS and RAY running up with ROADIES and OTHERS.
What the hell happened! (to Jim) Don't touch Jim. Get some water.  Don't touch your eyes.
(in pain) I BEEN BLINDED MAN. I BEEN MACED.
(realizing) Hey all he said was...
He was WHAT! He's Jim Morrison for  chrissake. Jim, Jim -- you okay --  let's get you under the water here.  Don't touch, you'll be okay.
COP 2 comes up.
I'm going to have to issue a warrant  for his arrest.
Are you NUTS! (blocking them)
JIM guided back into the shower stall by his entourage, e blind as Oedipus, starts to laugh. A black Irish laugh. Ray looking on PATRICIA in the hallway. A beat, senses wh happened.
Why don't you leave him alone lady,  he doesn't need more shit in his  life.
What do you know what Jim needs?
A precise military Drum Beat hits as we launch into "The  Unknown Soldier".
...Hup two -- three -- four...
THE DOORS on stage, JIM - eyes masked, facing death at a  mock execution, in full black leather armor.
Present arms!... The famous drum roll, tension building. Sudden sound of  guitar. Jim crumples to the ground. Blood shooting from h mouth.

Make a grave for the unknown soldier  Nestled in your hollow shoulder  The unknown soldier  Practice as the news is read  Television children dead  Bullet strikes the helmet's head  It's all over  The war is over!
The audience is enrapt. Jim suddenly jumps up, looses the blood curdling scream of an aroused demon and the band ba into Willie Dixon's BACK DOOR MAN.
OH YEEEEAAAAHHHHHHHHHH!  AYYYYYYAAAAAMMMMAAA BACK DOOR MAN.

The FANS go wild, to the farthest reaches of the arena, a he grabs his crotch and shakes it at them. INSTAMATICS  flashing rapidly as the KIDS press forward at Jim fondlin the mike stand, sliding up and down its smooth shaft.
Well the men don't know  But the little girls unnerstan'...

Joints sail onto the stage at his feet, ready to be smoke A TEENAGE BOY & GIRL make a break thru the cordon of COPS the front of the stage, heading for Jim. The Cops chase t down mid-stage, and wrestle them back to the edge -- thro them back into the audience.
When all the good people are trying  to sleep  I'm out there making my midnight  creep  Yeah, cause I'm a backdoor man  The men don't know  But the little girls unnerstan'...

Danger fills the air, electric. Jim strutting, Indian lik up to one of the Cops, whipping off his hat and flipping to the Crowd, which roars with approval. A couple Cops lo at Jim, sensing they're being challenged but not sure how They shuffle and look offstage for direction. Their appar impotence brings redoubled jeering from the Kids. RAY, next to his stick of incense on the organ, shares a  look with JOHN as they head into the instrumental break i the song. There's something different about Jim -- more  demonic, more driven -- a spirit has taken him over. RAY'S POV -- JIM catching his look, but no recognition in those eyes. They're dark pools, like Warhol's eyes. He tu away, taking the mike and off the cuff rapping  improvisationally with the backbeat, keeping poetic meter
I wanna tell you 'bout something  that happened just a few minutes ago  right here in New Haven. This is New  Haven isn't it? New Haven,  Connecticut, United States of America?
The CROWD yells in acknowledgement, one stoned TEENAGER n from the waist up and ripped on beer, yelling out.
HEY MORRISON, is the West really the  best or are you just stoned on  weeeeeedddddd??????
(annoying) "Light My Fire". Sing "Light My Fire".  Yeah. Give us Light My Fire!... (giggles) We want Mick Jagger! Take your clothes  off Jim. Show it to us! We want the  Lizard King!
Jim ignores it, sits on the stage, lights a cigarette. Lo pause, tension building. Their catcalls for "Light My Fir die out as Jim faces them down. They wait... not knowing  what happens next.

(finally) Well I was with this girl backstage,  y'know. We got to talking and we  wanted some privacy, so we went into  this shower stall. We weren't doin'  anything y'know jes' standing there  and talking.

The AUDIENCE laughing, the band continuing to play, John  adding emphasis to Jim's words with various shots and rol Camera moving over the crowd picking out the KIDS, sensin the anarchy dormant in their faces.
...and then this little man came in  there, this little man in a little  blue suit and a little blue cap...
More COPS turning to face Jim from front stage, getting t point now. RAY sees it coming...
(redneck voice) And he said -- "Whatcha doin' there?"  I said, "nuthin'" and he said, "Well  you better get outta there or..."  "Or what" I asked him...
The AUDIENCE has now grown deadly silent. Nearly every co is facing JIM as he uses his dumb Southerner voice. RAY's eyes warning JIM.

And he started pushing me and I pushed  back and he didn't like that so he  reached back there and got out his  little can of mace. And sprayed it  right in my eyes. And blinded me.  Why? Cause I was alone in a room  with a lady doing what he would like  to be doing if he could ever get it  up without a gun.
The LIGHTS coming on suddenly, the AUDIENCE seething. Sho of "Fuck em! Right on!"
In the United States of America.  Land of the free. Home of the Brave  man -- in God We Trust right? TURN  OFF THE LIGHTS.

CROWD roars. A POLICE LIEUTENANT in his 50's, grey hair,  beefy, marches out onto the stage, standing next to Jim,  arms akimbo. A SECOND COP joins him. Ray rolling the music out into a silence as Jim sticks th mike in the officer's face, defiantly.
Say your thing man!
More cops come out, snatch the microphone, as Jim flashes the audience a "touchy aren't they?" shrug.
Young man you've gone too far. The  show's over. You're under arrest.
TWO more COPS moving on Jim, pinning both his arms and  dragging him off stage.
(scared) They're gonna beat the shit out of  him man!
RAY moving to intercede with SIDDONS and ROADIES.
(resisting) HEY... HEY! HEY!

Ray and Siddons are pushed aside by other cops. The crowd going nuts. Chairs are thrown. Kids rushing onto the stag where the Cops beat them back. ANNE is writing it all down on her notepad. A certain  satisfaction and joy at the unfolding of this event.
JIM is dragged roughly down a flight of stairs.
GET YOUR HANDS OFF ME SLAVE!
JIM is wrestled across the lot, pinned to the car and  handcuffed, punched and thrown into the car, yelling.  Journalists try to intercede, one is also arrested.
YOU'RE SLAVES. YOU'RE ALL A BUNCH OF  SLAVES. THIS ISN'T HAPPENING TO ME  MAN, THIS IS HAPPENING TO YOU!!!
JIM is spreadeagled against the wall, a dignified, defian look on his face.
(coming in) Hey whatcha got here? A boy or a  girl?
(coming closer to Jim) What do you care. You're gonna fuck  him anyway... Okay rock star, let's  see the backdoor you keep bawling  about. (stretching his ass  cheeks) Where's the roach powder?
Ain't he the prettiest long-haired  boy y'ever saw?
(reaching for a can) Turn around rock star.
As Jim defiantly does so, Cop 2 looses a big cloud of roa powder into his long hair.
(backing off) Stand clear, who the hell knows what's  living in there?
All during this, snickering laughter from the onlooking h dozen POLICE OFFICERS gathered to watch. Jim waits, then  with great claim, in a quiet voice:

You finished? You sure you're  finished? Haven't you forgotten  something -- the consolation prize  they gave ya for taking your cock  and balls? The guns. Why don't you  use em you withered dicks! You shit- eating red-neck chickenshit bastards,  I hope this makes your worthless  lives...
As he's smacked by COP 2, sending him sprawling into the  wall...
(on the floor, quiet) You better kill me cause I'm gonna  come back and fuck everyone of your  daughters...

A SNOWBALL smashes against the glass. COPS coming out wit sticks. A RIOT brewing. A HUNDRED TEENAGERS sallying back and for on the sidewalk, taunting the cops. A dozen of them have  already been arrested.
LET JIM GO!!! MORRISON! MORRISON! WE  WANT MORRISON!
GET OUTTA HERE! GO HOME. GO ON NOW!

COPS chase the KIDS with sticks. But just as it looks lik it's going to get out of hand, JIM appears at the doors o the station, stepping out between RAY and the DOORS and  SIDDONS. He signals his freedom, arms in the air.
MOR-RI-SON! MOR-RI-SON! MOR-RI-SON!
Jim waves, does a small pained victory jig in front of th thwarted Gestapo, ribcage and spleen hurting.
JIM JIM JIM JIM JIM JIM...
(aside to Robbie) He could go all the way man! In five  years he could be in the White House.  Another JFK.
Robbie's look tells us he thinks Ray is as much caught up his dreams as Jim.
FLASHBULBS hits us full frame as:
A reminder of the reality as the thud of a clanking gate  shuts. MORRISON's profile, disheveled hair -- he glares  angrily.
FRONTAL SHOT, slated Police Dept -- New Haven Conn -- 237 12-10-67. A sullen handsome portrait.
JIM drinks... an ugly cough. Silence. In this puffy wrack and ruin there is still the ironic tones and sweet deligh of the boy amazed and amused by it all. We hear the ghost CROWD still cheering.

I drink so I can talk to assholes.  This includes me. Let's just say I  was testing the bounds of reality --  that's-all -- I was curious... I  kinda always preferred to be hated.  Like Erich Von Stroheim in the  movies... the man you loved to hate...  it's meant to be ironic, courage  wants to laugh. Y'know it's  essentially a stupid situation. I go  out on a stage and I howl for people.  In me they see what they want to see --  some say the Lizard King, whatever  that means, or some black-clad leather  demon whatever that means... but  really I think of myself as a  sensitive, intelligent human being  but with the soul of a clown which  always forces me to blow it at the  most crucial moment... (pause) a fake hero... a joke the gods played  on me... it's okay, I accept the  joke... and smile. Death old friend,  death and my cock, I can forgive my  injuries in the name of wisdom,  luxury, romance. Words got me the  wound and will get me well. All join  now in lament of my cock, a tongue  of knowledge in the feathered night.  Boys get crazy in the head and suffer.  I sacrifice my cock on the alter of  silence.
The ENGINEER looking at him puzzled. Has Jim lost it? MIK his friend, is there in the Engineer's booth, with the Do SECRETARY, Leticia, and an elegant MYSTERY WOMAN. They're smoking dope, partying.
Hey Jim, how 'bout hitting a strip- joint? It's getting late and we can...
Nah, later...
The violent backbeat of THE WASP now picking up.

Now listen to this I'll tell you  about Texas Radio and the big beat  soft driven slow and mad like some  new language reaching your head with  the cold sudden fury of a divine  messenger let me tell you about  heartache and the loss of God  wandering, wandering in hopeless  night out here on the perimeter there  are no stars out here we is stoned,  immaculate... but I tell you this:  No eternal reward will forgive us  now for wasting the dawn.

JIM walks the dawn streets. Classic image -- jeans, boots jacket, the sun starting to rise on the smog and transluc pink light along Santa Monica Boulevard outside the cheap Alta Cienega Motel where he lives... PEACE FROG shoots us through.

Blood in the streets in the town of New Haven  Blood stains the roofs and palm trees of Venice  Blood in my love in the terrible summer  The bloody red sun of phantastic L.A. Over the SONG, a MONTAGE of the 60's passing to its darke side.

MARTIN LUTHER KING assassinated, BOBBY KENNEDY gunned dow PEGGY FLEMMING ice skating at the Olympics; A QUAKER burn himself to death protesting the war in Vietnam; B-52 bomb dropped on CAMBODIA; KENT STATE erupts; CHARLES MANSON is arrested.
JIM -- drinking in Barney's Bar.

text: Dissolve to CRITIC'S FACE. Back to Jim's face.  Superimpositions over it of:

LYNDON JOHNSON's dog face on TV withdrawing: NIXON waving he wins '68; Rowen and Martin's LAUGH IN; COLUMBIA STUDEN taking over; 3rd HEADLINE: "MORRISON BUSTED IN VEGAS". MA LUTHER KING going down again; NIXON winning; massive ANTI WAR PROTESTS in Washington; floating space ships in "2001 B-52s sailing over Vietnam 4th HEADLINE: "DOORS PROVOKE  CHICAGO RIOTS" -- again and again, faster, faster.

Blood is the rose of mysterious union!  There's blood in the streets & it's up to my knees  She came  Blood in the streets of Chicago  She came  Blood on the rise and it's following me  Just about the break of day (etc)  The river runs red down the legs of the city  She came  The women are crying red rivers of weeping The MONTAGE collides into an ECU on JIM -- drinking as if silence the images, the sounds we hear and see on his fac Spirits crying for release. In alcoholic solace. He passe out, head hitting the bar. Jim's English friend, MIKE, walks in, throwing a harsh sh of LA morning light across the dark bar and JIM's face, b eyed, passed out on the counter. He has a drinking paunch With him are TOM BAKER, "TOM", the actor from the Warhol  scene in New York and a huge biker type drinker named DOG one of Jim's roadmen, a beard fanning his chest, tattoos  everywhere. In the front of these three monoliths are abo twenty beer bottles, numerous Jack Daniels bottles emptie and a lesbian BARTENDRESS pouring up a breakfast shot of  bloody Marys... Mike hands Dog a breakfast in a brown pap bag.
Morning. Pour me breakfast Delores...
Delores pouring the bloody mary. As Mike scoffs at Jim pa out.
Whatsa matter with Jimbo? Can't handle  it huh (studying the beer  bottles for leftovers)
Pussy whipped, man...
DOG reaching in, dragging Jim's face up by the hair. Stic Mike's greasy eggs and bacon in front of Jim.
Hey Jim, come on babe, eat this. . .  one last place to go. Ray's getting  it on.
Jim is suddenly alert -- an instant and surprising  transformation, without hangover, eager eyed.

(sparkling) Alive she cried! Right Dog, another  cubic centimeter of chance (slaps Dog, notices  the eggs, queasy) Ugh, I can't eat this stuff, it'll  really make me sick. Gimme a Dos  Equis will ya Delores? And a Ramos  gin fizz with it.
Fuck man did you fade or what, we  were on a "death run" up to the 9000  building after the gig, you bet me a  grand you'd walk the ledge.
(instantly) Let's go... Right now!
Then mumbling about "gotta go home,  sanctuary," pussy whipped. We were  gonna film it! A thousand bucks! (to Delores) Give him a double.
A triple, Tom, shem and shaun...
...imagine me and Morrison in a fuckin  movie together, can you imagine two  powerful two-fisted Irish fucking  drinking guys in a movie, in a  documentary movie!!
I'll direct the shit out of it, man.  Dennis Hopper can do it, I can do  it.
(drinking the fizz  down) ...all of us direct it! In black and  white. Call it "Zero." A real road  movie! Two of these (points to drink) you feel a lot better.
As he pisses on the floor next to the bar stool.
Whatcha doing! Oh fuck.
Fuck you Morrison. You're outta here  you fuckhead, get out!
(lifting Jim out of  there) Come on Jimbo, one more place to go.  Ray's getting married man, this  morning, remember! You're the best  man.
Fuck Ray -- fuckin Pollock all he  cares about's money. Fuckin sell  out. You sold out too man. The last  album's shit, and lemme tell ya  something, people know it.
(defending Jim) Come on Baker, lighten up.
That's all right. I like it (that dopey smile)
(to Jim) Come on man, toe the line. Boots to  the pavement. Let's walk.
Sequence omitted from original script.
JIM, loose, wanders right into the traffic, waving to any trying to hitch a ride. DOG and the OTHERS going after hi Jim seen slipping a tablet from his pocket into his mouth
(to no one in  particular) I LOVE L.A. -- the best neon. City  of Night! City of Light... why are  you going to work? You're not slaves,  you're free, cars, you're free...
TOM catching up to him.
Awright shaddup Morrison, just cause  you don't gotta work. (going into his pocket) Give me some of your money, asshole,  and I'll yell anything you fucking  want.
(coming up) What was that speckled motherfucker  you just took? Give me some!
(yielding, to Tom) You gotta fail to succeed Tom, gotta  surrender to the waiting tides.
Moving through traffic. Horns honking, incessant insanity

RAY and DOROTHY take their vows in front of a HIPPIE PRIE ROBBIE and JOHN and their WIVES-TO-BE, and OTHERS from th BAND look on. PAMELA is all decked out in her best, wedding clothes, re satins from Morocco, five-inch clog heels, flowers in her hair. Looking around pissed as:

(ad lib) Awright, the vibrations are right  now, I feel peace and love here today,  I feel a grooviness coming on, do  you Ray Manzarek take your lady  love... (etc.) fill the white wings  of death, scatter your ashes  forever...
JIM slinks up through the trees, alone, quiet, changing f to face them as SUMMER'S ALMOST GONE plays sinuously.
Summer's almost gone  Where will we be  When the summer's gone?
(aside) Where the fuck you been man?
Man, I been here all the time...  over there watching. I'm really happy  for you Ray you found life...
He smiles innocently. Ray, a beat, turns away. Pam coming over, squeezes his hand, sweetly, no fights today, she's lady.

JIM, in dark glasses, strongly feeling the effects of the acid, stares at a box of Kellogg's Corn Flakes, unable to relate. Down the aisle PAMELA, in her wedding clothes, is pushing shopping cart, filled with the feast she's preparing. The Store is a haven for HIPPIES from Laurel Canyon, barefoot RUNAWAYS, BIKERS...
Jim, I need some safflower oil. Do  you think you can find me a bottle?
Safflower oil, sure.
And get some Gravy Train for Sage.
(obediently) Yes.
