head_text.subj: JANIS JOPLIN OVERDOSES IN LOS ANGELES.

text: A ROLLING STONE WANTED POSTER ON JIM -- "In the County of Dade/Dead -- Did He Or Didn't He?".
Before I sink into the big sleep  I want to hear  The scream of the butterfly  Come back baby  Back into my arms
The MUSIC continuing into a long backbeat without lyrics emphasizing the downward spiralling theme...
...Well, you gonna get rid of it?  Fucked up people y'know, crazies,  unwanted Indians just throw it in  the river.
Pause. PATRICIA -- four and a half months pregnant, stare A glary window onto a balcony overlooking the sea with Fl palms and a strip of beach. A room in a highrise hotel. J mess is everywhere.
I can't fucking believe you just  said that!
Patricia, wouldn't it be better to  have a kid with someone who wanted  to be its father?
It'd be a fucking genius, that's  what it'd be! You and me. The child  would be a god, goddess!
It'd be a monster.
A look. She's stunned, ugly wrath gathering. He tries to  soothe her.
I got this trial dragging on me,  Patricia. I couldn't support the kid --  I can't afford it and I don't want  the responsibility right now.
You're a COWARD!! A LITTLE BOY!! The  only way you can't afford it is  emotionally. You forgot your vows  man. They were forever in the goddess'  sight. Death doesn't part, only love  Jim!
Come on Patricia, I was stoned... it  seemed like the fun thing at the  time.
She pulls a dagger with a skull's head on it, goes for hi
I'm gonna cut your balls off Morrison!
(that smile) You want 'em?
(beat) FUCK YOU. I'm gonna have the kid.
Then it'll be your kid. If you want  the abortion I'll pay for it and  I'll come up to New York to be with  you when you have it.
No you won't.
Yes I will.

Bullshit Morrison (release him, stalks) You know who you are... (pause) NO. What difference does it make.  You know, you never pretended. I  did. I don't even like kids  particularly, (laughs to herself) but I don't want the other thing  either. I guess what I really want  is to throw myself off this fucking  balcony (Hurls the knife out  off the balcony) Well now that you've fucked the  future, Morrison, have you fucked  everything?... (cruelly) Have you looked at yourself in the  mirror. Your stomach...
(hurt, near tears) Please don't say those things to me,  Patricia.
She suddenly grasps him, clutching, hunger, lust.
Fuck me one last time, you worthless  piece of shit.
...the scream of the butterfly  Come back baby  Back into my arms On Jim's face.
TWO HUNDRED PERSONS are gathered on the lawn outside, ban decrying the Doors. A MIDDLE AGED SPEAKER, clean cut, squ dressed, expresses his outrage.

(bullhorn) ...endorsed by President Richard  Nixon! (cheers) The immoral conduct of degenerates  such as Jim Morrison is an  unacceptable insult to this country  and the principles for which it  stands...
We're getting tired of hanging around  Waiting around with our heads to the ground  I hear the gentle sound  Very near yet very far  Very soft, yeah, very clear  Come today, come today

Well uh, it's designed to wear you  down y'know... when that rap sheet  says the "United States of America  versus You" it takes you down day by  day, specially when no one really  gives a shit about, y'know, the First  Amendment that's on trial here...  Nobody says anything about that,  it's just uh did you take your pants  off y'know, I mean that's not what  it's about, it's about freedom, that's  what it's about... but who cares,  right? Freedom exists in a schoolbook.
(disinterested) ...but the promoters are cancelling  your shows, will this affect the way  you play?
Well, I can only open doors, M'am. I  can't drag people thru 'em. I'm no  savior.
But you've called yourself a shaman?
(beat, pained) Did I? Well, I'll tell ya, my words  stand a far better chance of being  around a hundred years from now than  my waistline.
As he goes into the courtroom, a dolled up REPORTER 1, th local anchor-lady turns to her camera.
The question that will be answered  today: Did Jim Morrison or did he  not take off his pants last March?  This is...
The judge passing sentence, distant, hazy under song. Dar shadows across the floor, silhouettes... the world bleak white...

James Douglas Morrison, I hereby  sentence you to sixty days of hard  labor in the Dade County Jail and  for public exposure I am sentencing  you to six months of the same, after  which you are to serve two years and  four months of probationary time.  [...]

(overlapping) I booked you round trip to New York  for Thursday, Pamela's called six  times, Patricia, Kathy, Judy, Gayle  is pregnant, she says but... you  gotta get straight, honey, go to  sleep, get a massage, go to the  dentist, get a haircut honey, you  gotta cool out...
Probably a bath too...
(reading a rock  magazine) Jesus Jim, this guy really despises  you.
...didn't invite us to Woodstock.  Twenty other groups but not...
What's heavy is the radio stations  pulling us from their playlists. The  big cities -- Philly, Cinci, Chicago,  Detroit -- it's insane! Record sales  suck!
(with irony, reading  something) "The band you love to hate".
(2nd Lawyer if  necessary) We can drag this appeal out for years,  we can keep you out of jail.
(drinking) You're drinking with number three.
Max firmly believes the FBI's behind  it. We're subpoenaing their records --  they had memos on you in Phoenix and  they got you extradicted to Miami  illegally without a felony...
A new image -- Jim Morrison as  "Renaissance Man" -- We bring you  back slow, quiet, the beard, elder  of the tribe.
(reading from review) ...like Lennon said "you either grow  with the music or it grows without  you."
Hey, it was fun.
All the voices merging into one:

First Hendrix now Janis Robbie flew  to Hawaii legalities pending  dispositions book in Toronto interview  with PBS renew your diverse license  psychic predictions nine paternity  suits fifty thousand dollar bond  recoup our losses Pamela's shopping  spree with your credit card Morrison  Hotel some-body from film school  mountain of coke in the broom closet  Jac Holzman eight thirty in the  morning remix perform schedule Paul  Rothchild taxes Texas teenyboppers  tomorrow.

Jim, during this, picking up the TV remote, flicking on t images. The VOICES blending with TV VOICES as he swithes channels. The camera moving in on Jim, the VOICES fading. All we see is Jim. All we hear and see is the TV:

Chicago Seven in it's tenth day...  Bobby Seale gagged and chained... (click) L.A. shootout with Black Panthers... (click) Charles Manson indicted for murder  of actress Sharon Tate... (click) U. S. ground troops in Laos and  Cambodia... (click) Indians still occupying Alcatraz  Island... (click) For the My Lai massacre testified  120 villagers shot by American  soldiers in a trench...
The SONG climaxes into an inner scream of madness.
For the music is your special friend  Dance on fire as it intends  Music is your only friend  Until the end (3)  (SCREAM!)
Silence on Jim.
(mildly) I think I'm having a nervous  breakdown.
The sound of wind, the backbeat of LA WOMAN flooding in.

JIM dangles out on the narrow ledge that circumscribes th 20th floor rooftop -- wind blowing thru his wild hair, th card zooming by like racer lights on Sunset below. The so LA WOMAN continues born from this renewed feeling of dang

Well I just got into town 'bout an hour ago  Took a look around, see which way the wind blow  Where the little girls in their Hollywood bungalows PAM screaming for him to come back from the edge as TOM B and MIKE and DOG and a CAMERAMAN film in 16mm.
JIM! PLEASE GODDAMIT!! COME BACK IN  PLEASE!!
JIM yelling back, as he drinks from a pint of whiskey,  enjoying himself enormously.
Whatcha worried about? I like it out  here.
He feigns a fall.
NOOOOOO!!
RAY and SIDDONS arrive, terrified, looking for him.
(laughing at Pam) Life on the edge baby. Come get me  if you love me baby.
PLEASE GODDAMIT JIM MORRISON I'M NOT  GONNA KILL MYSELF FOR YOU. GET IN  HERE.
Jim cracking up with laughter. BAKER, drunk and the FILM  CREW love it, swishpanning with a cheap sungun.
(dancing) We got it man! Keep going. Great get  a two shot.
GO ON GET OUT THERE PAM.
Pam is sufficiently cracked on her own set of drugs to st climbing out onto the ledge, skirts blowing in the wind.
JIM MORRISON GODDAMIT I LOVE YOU I  WANT YOU I NEED YOU.
Jim moving further along the ledge.
(raw) YOUR WHOLE LIFE'S BULLSHIT! YOU LOVE  ME THEN COME AND GET ME.

LA Woman (X2)  LA Woman Sunday afternoon (X3)  Drive thru your suburbs  Into your blues (X2)  Into your blue-blue  Blues  Into your blues Siddons and Ray terrified. Is this the night it's finally going to end in a suicide plunge? Ray trying to stop Pam, too late.
Pam!! Oh shit... get the ambulances  man...
Pam's moving shakily along the ledge, cracked on downers. Jim watching her come, amazed at her risk.
(yelling down) JIM! HELP HER. She's gonna fall.
Jump!
He watches, does nothing.
Come on baby, come on.
(trying another tack) Jim we gotta finish "LA Woman".
Don't have an ending Ray.
Reaches his hand out. She is closer. But shaky.
(white) They're both gonna die... ARE YOU  HAPPY YOU COCKSUCKERS!!

Ray goes after Tom Baker and the Film Crew. A scuffle.  Yelling, shouting, but down below in the intimacy of the  ledge, blowing out on the edge, the wind and the world an death. Two crazy children linked on this gothic balcony o the Chateau reach their hands out for each other.
Come on baby, come on
(quoting him) "...but one, the most beautiful one  of all -- dances in a ring of fire -- "
(raw singing) "I see your hair is burning. If they  say I never loved you, you know they  are a liar!"
"...and throws off the challenge  with a shrug"
All the poetry has wolves in it Pam!!!
She has never been so concentrated, inching closer to him Her heels overhanging oblivion.
I don't wanna die with you Jim  Morrison, I don't wanna die!
Never saw a woman  So alone (X2)  So alone -- lone lone
C'mon Pam, this is it! We'll do it  right here! Right now! You and me!

Ray, Tom, Siddons, Mike, Dog, they all watch in horror,  sensing it will happen. They have even stopped filming.  Inches... inches. He dodges her touch, confused... to the last possible sec Then SHE'S THERE -- in his arms. Her arms latch around hi and she hugs him with all her wiry soul.
Jim -- let's go, let's leave this  town! You and me! Never come back.
(demonic) We can. Right now. Just one more  step...
No Jim. I want to LIVE with you. I  want to LIVE with you.
The two lovers huddled together on the ledge. He slips hi head down on her lap, looking up into her eyes with the  strangest tears in his eyes.

(a poem) There was preserved in her the fresh  miracle of surprise... clothed in  sunlight restless in wanting dying  of fever married to doubt how it has  changed you how slowly estranged you  solely arranged you beg for your  mercy -- OR -- ...but all will pass  lie down in green grass and smile  and muse and gaze upon her smooth  resemblance to the mating-Queen who  it seems is in love with the horseman  Tomorrow we enter the tomb of my  birth I want to be ready.
On her face -- moved. Pause. LA WOMAN floods in on his sm an upbeat surge. Upstairs, the ONLOOKERS relax. HOTEL MANAGEMENT and COPS now rushing up in background.
Mr. Mojo Rising  Mr. Mojo Risin' (X2)
There's music rocking from the inside. Cables and baffles run from the second story down to the rehearsal room on t first.
Keep on risin'  Got to keep on risin'  Risin' Risin' (X8)
The SECRETARIES and STAFF dance to the SOUND rocking thru the floor.

Well I just got into town about an hour ago  Took a look around, see which way the wind blow Camera moving thru the offices, past the OFFICE BOY, past SIDDONS, past the PUBLICIST, etc -- a farewell to the ban
We see RAY, ROBBIE, JOHN, BOTNICK, a BASS and 2nd RHYTHM  GUITARIST, WIVES, GIRLFRIENDS but no Jim. They're really  driving, the music soars. PAMELA'S hair shaking as she sw to the beat.
With a little girl in a Hollywood  bungalow  Are you a lucky lady in the City of  Light?  Or just another lost angel -- City  of Night?

Wires run into a tiny toilet revealing JIM with headphone to his ears barking into a dangling mike, one leg propped a toilet seat, in a groove. A new, strange, unparalleled  beauty in his voice, hoarser but wiser, haunted by experi yet joyful as youth, Jim is ironically, at his best.
LA Woman (X2)  LA Woman / Sunday Afternoon (X3)  Drive thru your suburbs  Into your blues (X2)  Into your blue-blue blues
MONTAGE: Moving, moving, moving -- all the POVS from fast moving CARS travelling with the pace of L.A. Song of free of escape -- the STRIP, the cars, the freeway, the  BILLBOARDS... farewell L.A.
Camera creeping towards ANNE O'RIORDAN as she waits, alon on a white table for the doctor to arrive. Jim never show up after all. But on we go.
I see your hair is burning  Hills are filled with fire  If they say I never lov'd you  You know they are a liar (etc)  Never saw a woman  So alone (X2)  So alone lone lone  So alone
JIM drives up in his beaten GTO MUSTANG, top down, bags a over the place, hops out. Carrying his bulk with grace, k and rings. RIDERS ON THE STORM starting to play over.
DOROTHY opens the door. Jim a stack of presents under his arm.
Eek Dorothy! You cut your hair!
We're trying to have another baby.
(moving past her) What -- was your hair getting in the  way? (she smacks him lightly) Where are the kids?

He spots them, crossing to the YARD where a CHILDREN'S  BIRTHDAY is in progress -- TWO DOZEN KIDS, a CLOWN acting out for them. A few parents and friends -- ROBBIE and LYN their kid, JOHN and his RECENT LADY, their kid... When the KIDS spot JIM they light up.
Hey -- am I late or is this the cool  remnant of a dream?
(rushing to him) Eee! Jim! It's Uncle Jim... Come  on... what did you bring me Jim...
(picks up Robin) How's my girl! And how's my boy!

They stick a ludicrous printed birthday hat on his head. bearded Santa Claus now engulfed with kids, though puffy, body gone, a literal physical wreck, yet a gentle pathos  about him and still a charisma that the children react to without thinking. He gives out the presents all over.
(ad libs) For you... Pancho gets this one...  Melanie -- yours... Hey Dorothy don't  grab now... open that one, that's  yours... keep your paws off that  now...
As RAY and ROBBIE and JOHN and the others circle him.
(to Robin, a 5 year  old) ...and to you, princess, from your  Royal servant, James Douglas Morrison (bows)
As ROBIN, the cutest of them all, a bow in her hair, take the package, opens it.
You wanna hear the new mixes on "LA  WOMAN?"...
No, I gotta plane to catch.
Won't take long man, it's the best  one since "Days".
We added rain to "Riders", come on.

Jim cocks his head, listening to it playing from an inner room, his eyes on ROBIN opening the gift -- a beautiful,  ANTIQUE DOLL of an 19th century poet -- rock star, stuffe velour jacket, white fluffy lace collar, it could be Byro or it could be Jim Morrison -- in fact the hair is perfec weaved to resemble Jim in his young lion phase -- an iron gift, meant from the heart. It stops everybody -- they al look. A haunted quality to the doll.
Ugh! What's that!
(to Jim) It's you.
Forever young...
She kisses him.
Oh it's beautiful... Thank you Uncle  Jim.
Off the patio windows of the birthday party, sounds and  sunshine pouring in. The Clown running around, laughter. music plays -- BRUCE at the mixing board.

Riders on the Storm (x2)  Into this house we're born  Into this world we're thrown  Like a dog without a bone  An actor out on loan  Riders on the storm Where we and Jim came in, I guess. Jim drinks from a cogn bottle straight, foot tapping, enjoying it, knows it's go but other things are calling. This is history.
I gotta admit -- that ain't bad for  four guys who weren't even talking  that day.
Slapping shoulders, shaking hands.
You really gonna live in Paris man?
Yeah John, be anonymous, write a  book: "Observations of an American  While on Trial in Miami".
I still think we got a couple of  great blues albums in us man.
I'm pinned man. Everything I do they  got a category for it, y'know.  Freedom's gone.
Hey, I'm gonna miss you Jim. I'm  gonna miss the feeling of playing  music with you.
You can always whip the horses' eyes.  You, John, miss me?
More than you think asshole. (turn away, repressing --  the emotions)
(walking him to the  garden) Well far as I'm concerned, Jim, I  made music with Dionysus man. We had  some moments on stage like no one  will ever fucking know.
(making light) Yeah, yeah -- and you lay off those  drugs Rob. We're gonna play again  some day.
Jim -- "do not go gently into that  good night. Rage rage against the  dying of the light". (he winks goodbye)
The kids running up to grab JIM, pulls him back to the pa
Come 'ere Uncle Jim, we're playing  blind man's bluff...

JIM, a bearded Santa Claus with the birthday hat on his h surrounded by the GIRLS and BOYS and DOROTHY shooting a h movie. They're eating birthday cake but UNCLE JIM is drin straight from the cognac bottle -- a strange sight.
(to Robin) So what are you gonna be when you  grow up?
I wanna be your wife
He laughs, looks at Dorothy who's shooting him with the S 8.
I don't know, can I afford you? Pam  kinda wiped me out with her dress  store y'know...
I'll make my own dresses and you'll  see, I'll be the best wife.
(nodding) You'll never be alone Jim.
(to Dorothy) You know I've never been happier.  Not as much of a rush as I used to  be in y'know... this is the strangest  life I've ever known.

His eyes on a LITTLE BOY who's walking into the party, si down with the others, ignored, isolated, a birthday cap o his head. Clothes belong to the 1940's and the face seems familiar. Jim is not sure, woozy from the cognac. As he f We saw the Boy many years ago in the backseat of the car the Arizona desert. Jim's head falling gently into his folded arms on the tab the cognac bottle at his elbow, merlin hat on, beard, the kids laughing, pulling his ears and nose -- he doesn't wa up.
As Ray comes over now, rouses him gently.
Gotta plane to catch man?
Jim coming awake in that instant alert way of his, but  obviously hung over.
O?... splittling headache from which  the future is made.
Puzzling remark, He gets up, shaky, exits, kids tearing a him. Goodbyes.
The beach is behind them, the last of the frisbee players and dogs, the skaters go by, as we continue to hear RIDER from within.
Is Pam really there in Paris waiting?
(ironic, head hurts) Sure. The Count's there so where  else would she be? Gotta try to start  over, without all the hassles, y'know.  I think we can.
I never knew what you saw in that  nightmare chick man.

Well she is kinda flakey -- like me.  I mean she's just so vulnerable about  everything. It makes me sad man. (pause) But she's always kinda believed in  something about me y'know -- her  little picture of me as the unsung  poet -- and it's a fantasy I kinda  dig y'know, 'stead of the one I live.
I don't know man, I don't wanna sound  like your old man but you're only  27, you're living like you gotta get  it all in, you gotta slow down man,  you did it, you broke thru to the  other side.
We didn't break thru Ray, we just  pushed things a little. When you  really break thru, there's nothing  left. No music, no Doors, no God,  nothing -- only a will to power.

I don't believe that. You were an  American prince, man -- with overbred  genes -- (Jim scoffs, laughs) No! What could've been Jim? You  could've been President. (Jim cracks up) No man! What could've been Jim? We  stood here on this beach on the edge  of the Pacific that crazy summer day  in '65 -- and we knew, you and I, we  knew we were at the edge of the mind.  we were there, man. One planet, one  globe, one mind. Consciousness, we  raised it, we were there.
Jim, not the sentimental type, climbs in his car, amused.
And now what?
Now? (smiles, lethally  sweet) You've made me into Ishmael. I am  the last survivor of the Pequod. And  I exist only to tell the story of  Ahab who fought the black whale.
(loves it, laughs) It was white Ray. You gotta stop  harpin' on that day. I was so ripped  I can hardly remember it.
Ignites engine. Ray leans in, lightening up.
Hey, what was that poem you once  wrote about two chicks on the pier?
Come on man, I gotta fly.
Come on. Just once.

(VOICE OVER, pulling  out the car) In that year we had a great  Visitation of energy  Back in those days  Everything was simpler and more  confused  One summer night, going to the pier  I ran into two young girls  The blonde was called Freedom  The dark one Enterprise  We talked  And they told me this story.
As he departs, waving.
(OVER) What was the story?
His point of view -- Jim receding into the sun in his mus making a shakey, screeching curve at the bend of the beac And he's gone. An ominous ROAR of an AIRPLANE above RAY. flying away.

The PLANE flies off into the setting ball of red sun. INT. RECORDING SESSION (LAST SESSION) - L.A. - DEC. The bearded POET hunches in his chair, exhausted, clutchi the paper, finished. Pause. He downs a final shot, grunts the Indian Ghostman sitting there on a stool watching him the corner of the studio. The Ghostman laughs (but nothin comes out of his mouth). His wrinkled eyes are happy,  feathered ponytail, he nods... pleased.
Well, didja get all that?
You done good, Jim, go now -- rest
The ENGINEER, exhausted, doesn't feel anything funny.
Yeah, I got it Jim.
The poets face brightens. A small but ever-so-sweet smile triumph hikes up the corners of his mouth.
Aw right. Let's get some tacos!

He stands, sways, than moves out of view. The empty bottl of whiskey, its sands run out, is left behind. As we FADE OUT, a hardy, mischievous Morrison laugh and a ripple of sensuous MUSIC carry us into the lilting, lamen strains of AN AMERICAN PRAYER -- THE END without lyrics f now as we cut to:
PAMELA is agitated in her sleep -- waking as she feels hi watching. Is that him? At the door? A SHADOW -- leaves.  Footsteps moving down the narrow Parisian corridor with t creaky floor.
Jim... that you?

Looks at the time. Somewhere near dawn. The sounds of a b being drawn. Nightmare or sleep? She tries to fade back t sleep but the MUSIC and the WHISPERING prod her, pull her awake... DISSOLVE: SAME FACE -- AN HOUR LATER. Putting her robe on, the slippers, the light... moving. S is much more ravaged looking than before.
She finds him now... His face floating upwards, angelic e the beard is now gone, a little smile on his face. He mus be playing another joke. Although she really knows as she says the words:
Jim! It was you. I always know when  it's you. (moving closer) Come on baby get out of the tub...  mama'll dry you off... (pause) Jim Morrison, now you stop joking  you hear me, cut it out!
His face. At peace, as she sobs, the MUSIC cresting to Ji lyrics.
...was it all right Jim, did you  enjoy it when it came my baby? Just  like you said it'd be?

(OVER) They are waiting to take us into the  severed garden do you know how pale  and wanton thrillful comes death at  a strange hour? Unannounced unplanned  for like a scaring overfriendly guest  you've brought to bed? Death makes  angels of us all? And gives us wings  where we had shoulders smooth as  raven's claws...

His face etching into a perfect Alexandrine bust of physi beauty. The camera moving to reveal, a wintry day, leaves blowing, the wild cats everywhere in the empty cemetery, crumbling tombs, the flowers fresh and dead around Jim's  tomb, the graffiti, wine bottles, Wilde, Bizet, Piaf, Cho Morrison...

(OVER) No more money, no more fancy dress  this other kingdom seems by far the  best until its other jaw reveals  incest and loose obedience to a  vegetable law. I will not go I prefer  a feast of friends to the giant  family...
The MUSIC rolling up on:

Smoke. Some lights. The distant cheers of a CROWD. In sli SLOW MOTION, a FIGURE moves down a corridor into a blindi light of stage and smoke. THREE OTHER SHADOWS are there  waiting -- as the GHOST moves to the microphone in altere motion. The AUDIENCE is out there somewhere in the dark -- we sen they too have become ghosts, as all of us will one day. T MUSIC continuing up to roll from AMERICAN PRAYER -- THE E snatches we annotate.
Ladies and Gentlemen, from Los Angeles  California -- The Doors! (ghostly applause)

(snatches) ...have you seen the warm progress  under the stars?  Have you forgotten the keys to the  kingdom?  Have you been born yet and are you  alive?  Where is the feast we were promised?  Let's reinvent the gods, the myths  of the ages!  We need great golden copulations
Camera closing past the DOORS to JIM alone, circling the  mike with his dance -- the INDIAN GHOSTMAN jigging, shama like, off to the side -- now levitating above the stage, crazy, gawky dancing.

Well, I'll tell you a story of  whiskey, mystics and men  And about the believers and how the  whole thing began  First there were women and children  obeying the moon  Then daylight brought wisdom and  sickness too soon... the moon is a  dry blood beast  We have assembled inside this ancient  and insane theatre to propagate our  lust for life and flee the swarming  wisdom of the streets we live we die  and death not ends it (screams in agony) FATHER HAVE MERCY!!!
Ending with a solitary sing-song croak.

Bird of prey, bird of prey  Flying high, flying high in the summer  sky  Bird of prey, bird of prey flying  high, flying high gently pass by  Bird of prey, bird of prey flying  high, flying high  Take me on your flight (pause then) I will come again down from the wild  mountains

head_text.subj: THE SUBTITLE READS "JIM IS SAID TO HAVE DIED OF 'HEART
FAILURE'. PAMELA JOINED HIM THREE YEARS LATER"... HER ASH

text: ...Let's lighten it up with some good old rock and roll. we hear Jim and the Doors running loose on ROADHOUSE BLUE

ALRITE YEAH YEAH  YOU GOTTA ROLL, ROLL, ROLL  YOU GOTTA THRILL MY SOUL -- ALRITE  ROLL, ROLL, ROLL, ROLL,  A THRILL MY SOUL  A-GOT-A-BEEPA, GONCHA CHUCHNA HOCA  CONK,  A DONTA EATCHA COONA NEECHA BOP-A- LOOLA, LECHOW, BOMPA KECHOW YESOW  CONK, YEAH  RITE ASHEN LADY (X2)  GIVE UP YOUR VOWS (X2)  SAVE OUR CITY (X2)  RIGHT NOW (X2)  WELL I WOKE UP THIS MORNING I GOT  MYSELF A BEER (X2)  THE FUTURE'S UNCERTAIN THE END IS  ALWAYS NEAR  LET IT ROLL BABY ROLL (X3)  ALL NITE LONG
